author: ZizzyZizzy
body:
When emailing files using Send-MailMessage, they show up named with the full path to the file + filename instead of just the short file name. I've attempted changing the current working directory to the location where the attachment lives, then stripping off the path, but then Send-MailMessage complains that it can't find the file because it's looking in the folder where the script lives. This is also a security risk. Not only does it expose that the system is Linux, it exposes the full path to the file. Steps to reproduce ------------------ $MasterCSVFile = "/some/path/to/MasterCSV_List.csv" $MessageBody = "All VM's for vCenter $servername" $MessageBody += $VMSortedMasterList | format-table -AutoSize | out-string $MessageBody = '
{0}
' -f [System.Net.WebUtility]::HtmlEncode($MessageBody) $MessageSubject = "VM List for vCenter " + $servername $messageParameters = @{ Body = $MessageBody Subject = $MessageSubject From = $FromEmail To = $ToEmail SmtpServer = $SMTPServer Attachments = $MasterCSVFile } Send-MailMessage @messageParameters -BodyAsHtml Expected behavior ----------------- Attachment should be named "**MasterCSV_List.csv**" Actual behavior --------------- Attachment is named "**/some/path/to/MasterCSV_List.csv**" and will not open in Gmail's preview like it does using an attached CSV file from a Windows PowerShell session. Environment data ---------------- ``` PS /root/powershell> $PSVersionTable Name Value ---- ----- PSVersion 6.1.0-preview.2 PSEdition Core GitCommitId v6.1.0-preview.2 OS Linux 3.10.0-693.21.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Mar 7 19:03:37 UTC 2018 Platform Unix PSCompatibleVersions {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...} PSRemotingProtocolVersion 2.3 SerializationVersion 1.1.0.1 WSManStackVersion 3.0 RPM: Name : powershell Version : 6.1.0~preview.2 Release : 1.rhel.7 Architecture: x86_64 Install Date: Tue 15 May 2018 02:15:56 PM EDT Group : shells Size : 141014973 License : MIT License Signature : RSA/SHA256, Thu 26 Apr 2018 05:01:23 PM EDT, Key ID eb3e94adbe1229cf Source RPM : powershell-6.1.0~preview.2-1.rhel.7.src.rpm Build Date : Wed 25 Apr 2018 01:59:52 PM ED ``` Here is what shows up in the email header: ``` ----boundary_0_5c9a4c9c-1387-4d6e-8d4a-7a8c31a3479a Content-Type: application/octet-stream; name=""/some/path/to/MasterCSV_List.csv" Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64 Content-Disposition: attachment ```

My observation is slightly different .
Attachment is having the absolute path of the file without the path separator.
If attachment path is `/mnt/c/test.log`, in mail the attachment name is `mntctest.log`

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: @iSazonov  I have tried with `System.Net.Mail` APIs and found the same issue, So the issue is in .Net Core in Linux and seems like fix is on the way, from [here](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/320fda36fb617a119ea11b15ef150cd5b817479e/src/System.Net.Mail/src/System/Net/Mail/Attachment.cs) and we have a parent #6564

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@kvprasoon Thanks!
The issue is dup #6564. Fix is already in .Net Core 2.1. So we can test with current night builds or wait Preview3.
